etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Robert Mayne (1808–1868). From phallus + -oid, originally after post-classical Latin phalloides phallus-like, used specifically of fungi from ancient Greek ϕαλλός penis + post-classical Latin -oides

definitions: Resembling an erect penis; (Mycology) denoting fungi of the order Phallales (typified by the genus Phallus).
A fungus of the order Phallales.
